SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.epics.pvData.pv
Interface Convert

public interface Convert

Convert between numeric types, convert any field to a string, or convert from a string to a scalar field.

Numeric conversions are between scalar numeric types or between arrays of numeric types. It is not possible to convert between a scalar and an array. Numeric conversions are between types: pvByte, pvShort, pvInt, pvLong, pvFloat, or pvDouble.

getString converts any supported type to a String. Code that implements a PVField interface can implement method toString by calling this method.

fromString converts a String to a scalar. fromStringArray converts an array of String to a pvArray, which must have a scaler element type. A scalar field is a numeric field or pvBoolean or pvString.

All from methods put data into a PVField, e.g. from means where the PVField gets it's data. All from methods call postPut after calling the appropriate put method.

Author:
mrk

indentLevel - indentation level
Returns:
value converted to string

fromString

void fromString(PVScalar pv,
                java.lang.String from)
Convert a PV from a String. The PV must be a scaler.

Parameters:
pv - The PV.
from - The String value to convert and put into a PV.
Throws:
java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the String does not have a valid value.

fromStringArray

int fromStringArray(PVArray pv,
                    int offset,
                    int len,
                    java.lang.String[] from,
                    int fromOffset)
Convert a PV array from a String array. The array element type must be a scalar.

Parameters:
pv - The PV.
offset - Starting element in a PV.
len - The number of elements to transfer.
from - The array of values to put into the PV.
fromOffset - Starting element in the source array.
Returns:
The number of elements converted.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the element Type is not a scalar.
java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the String does not have a valid value.

Parameters:

offset - Starting element in the PV array. param len Number of elements to convert to the string array.
to - String array to receive the converted PV data.
toOffset - Starting element in the string array.
Returns:
Number of elements converted.

isCopyScalarCompatible

boolean isCopyScalarCompatible(Scalar from,
                               Scalar to)
Are from and to valid arguments to copyScalar. false will be returned if either argument is not a scalar as defined by Type.isScalar(). If both are scalars the return value is true if any of the following are true.
  • Both arguments are numeric.
  • Both arguments have the same type.
  • Either argument is a string.

Parameters:
from - The introspection interface for the from data.
to - The introspection interface for the to data..
Returns:
(false,true) If the arguments (are not, are) compatible.

copyScalar

void copyScalar(PVScalar from,
                PVScalar to)
Copy from a scalar pv to another scalar pv.

Parameters:
from - the source.
to - the destination.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the arguments are not compatible.

isCopyArrayCompatible

boolean isCopyArrayCompatible(Array from,
                              Array to)
Are from and to valid arguments to copyArray. The results are like isCopyScalarCompatible except that the tests are made on the elementType.

Parameters:
from - The from array.
to - The to array.
Returns:
(false,true) If the arguments (are not, are) compatible.

copyArray

int copyArray(PVArray from,
              int offset,
              PVArray to,
              int toOffset,
              int len)
Convert from a source PV array to a destination PV array.

Parameters:
from - The source array.
offset - Starting element in the source.
to - The destination array.
toOffset - Starting element in the array.
len - Number of elements to transfer.
Returns:
Number of elements converted.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the arguments are not compatible.

isCopyStructureCompatible

boolean isCopyStructureCompatible(Structure from,
                                  Structure to)
Are from and to valid arguments for copyStructure. They are only compatible if they have the same Structure description.

Parameters:
from - from structure.
to - structure.
Returns:
(false,true) If the arguments (are not, are) compatible.

copyStructure

void copyStructure(PVStructure from,
                   PVStructure to)
Copy from a structure pv to another structure pv. NOTE: Only compatible fields are copied. This means:
  • For scalar fields this means that isCopyScalarCompatible is true.
  • For array fields this means that isCopyArrayCompatible is true.
  • For structure fields this means that isCopyStructureCompatible is true.
  • Link fields are not copied.

Parameters:
from - The source.
to - The destination.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the arguments are not compatible.

newLine

void newLine(java.lang.StringBuilder builder,
             int indentLevel)
Convenience method for implementing toString. It generates a newline and inserts blanks at the beginning of the newline.

Parameters:
builder - The StringBuilder being constructed.
indentLevel - Indent level, Each level is four spaces.
